results.content: it seems like a great course and i really want to like it but the learner is forced to use a plugin for short cuts. the plugin doesn't work properly with notepad++ and i don't want to use a different text editor. this course would be better if it was taught by typing the HTML manually and taught how to use the emmet plugin as an option rather than as an essential feature. if you try to follow along without the plugin then the course is too fast and the learner has to keep pausing the video.

results.content_html: Its really a good course.

results.content: This is a really great course!  Since taking the Igneus Technologies course on Bootstrap 3 (The Bootstrap Bootcamp), I have been seeking out courses specifically by IT.  I have been doing front end work for about two years now but felt certain there was something I could learn from this course; IT did not let me down!  My only issue with the course is that, while it definitely would benefit beginners, I personal feeling is that utilizing Emmet's autofill function takes away from complete novices.  If you have to actually type out every single line of code, character by character, you learn the syntax more completely (like with the needed link tag attributes, for example).  However, any beginner could simply not utilize the autofill function and do it the hard way in order to more fully understand the syntax of programming code.
results.content_html: This is a really great course! Since taking the Igneus Technologies course on Bootstrap 3 (The Bootstrap Bootcamp), I have been seeking out courses specifically by IT. I have been doing front end work for about two years now but felt certain there was something I could learn from this course; IT did not let me down! My only issue with the course is that, while it definitely would benefit beginners, I personal feeling is that utilizing Emmet's autofill function takes away from complete novices. If you have to actually type out every single line of code, character by character, you learn the syntax more completely (like with the needed link tag attributes, for example). However, any beginner could simply not utilize the autofill function and do it the hard way in order to more fully understand the syntax of programming code.

Thank you

results.content:
The course started off well with the content on HTML and CSS, but this is the easier side of front-end development. Now that I've moved into JavaScript, the quality of instruction is much lower than the previous sections, and there seems to be a lot of tangential asides without much explanation as to what or why we're doing the tasks. For example, when covering the section on regex, I had no idea what it was or why it is used; after the video, 10 minutes on YouTube with another instructor cleared it up in a much more concise and logical manner. 
As others have previously stated, there's too much chit-chat and little comments that distract from the objectives of the lesson. I understand that the instructor is presenting the technical material in his non-native language, but please stick to the lesson and not random musings about Harleys, comics, etc.
Additionally, while some activities begin simple enough, others, such as "Functions as Objects", "Closure in Functions", "Call and Apply" and others start off seemingly at a more advanced level. As a former teacher, it's always best to begin your lessons at the most basic concepts, and then scale up with exercises and activities that increase in rigor. 
A final note: I have looked back through the Q and A section, and there are times when the instructor has answered students' questions. He is very lax on this however, and sometimes gives seemingly flippant remarks like, "Oops, I forgot to cover that, but you found the answer so you are now a full front-end dev!" This is not at all helpful. 
I'm hopeful the remaining 30%> is useful and provides more valuable insight so that I can adjust my rating, but I'm doubtful.
results.content_html:
The course started off well with the content on HTML and CSS, but this is the easier side of front-end development. Now that I've moved into JavaScript, the quality of instruction is much lower than the previous sections, and there seems to be a lot of tangential asides without much explanation as to what or why we're doing the tasks. For example, when covering the section on regex, I had no idea what it was or why it is used; after the video, 10 minutes on YouTube with another instructor cleared it up in a much more concise and logical manner.
As others have previously stated, there's too much chit-chat and little comments that distract from the objectives of the lesson. I understand that the instructor is presenting the technical material in his non-native language, but please stick to the lesson and not random musings about Harleys, comics, etc.
Additionally, while some activities begin simple enough, others, such as "Functions as Objects", "Closure in Functions", "Call and Apply" and others start off seemingly at a more advanced level. As a former teacher, it's always best to begin your lessons at the most basic concepts, and then scale up with exercises and activities that increase in rigor.
A final note: I have looked back through the Q and A section, and there are times when the instructor has answered students' questions. He is very lax on this however, and sometimes gives seemingly flippant remarks like, "Oops, I forgot to cover that, but you found the answer so you are now a full front-end dev!" This is not at all helpful.
I'm hopeful the remaining 30%> is useful and provides more valuable insight so that I can adjust my rating, but I'm doubtful.

results.content:
Se nota que el instructor tiene experiencia en los temas y muestra buenos recursos para usar en proyectos de la vida real. El problema es que tarda demasiado en explicar los conceptos, no profundiza demasiado (en especial en los conceptos de Javascript) y habla mucho de temas que no son de interés (el clima, cuánto le gusta como va quedando la web, etc). Sería bueno que sea más sintético y preciso, para tener tiempo de profundizar en los temas.

You can see that the instructor has experience in the subjects and shows good resources to use in real life projects. The problem is that it takes too long to explain the concepts, does not go too deep (especially in the Javascript concepts) and talks a lot about topics that are not of interest (the weather, how much he likes how the website is going, etc). It would be good to be more synthetic and precise, to have time to delve into the subjects.
results.content_html:

Sería bueno que sea más sintético y preciso, para tener tiempo de profundizar en los temas.

You can see that the instructor has experience in the subjects and shows good resources to use in real life projects. The problem is that it takes too long to explain the concepts, does not go too deep (especially in the Javascript concepts) and talks a lot about topics that are not of interest (the weather, how much he likes how the website is going, etc). It would be good to be more synthetic and precise, to have time to delve into the subjects.
